intro: Rubus × proceroides, commonly known as the evergreen blackberry, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, thorny shrubs and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that range in color from red to black, depending on the variety. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and for commercial use.
